intro: Diplazium whitfordii, commonly known as the New Zealand fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional Māori medicine for their purported healing properties. Diplazium whitfordii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
